abstract: The federal agency that oversees Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac is expected to sue Bank of America, Goldman Sachs and others, accusing them of failures in vetting mortgages during the housing bubble.
snippet: The federal agency that oversees Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac is expected to sue Bank of America, Goldman Sachs and others, accusing them of failures in vetting mortgages during the housing bubble.
lead_paragraph: The federal agency that oversees the mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac is set to file suits against more than a dozen big banks, accusing them of misrepresenting the quality of mortgage securities they assembled and sold at the height of the housing bubble, and seeking billions of dollars in compensation.

headline.main: U.S. Is Set to Sue a Dozen Big Banks Over Mortgages
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Set to Sue Dozen Big Banks Over mortgages

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal National Mortgage Association Fannie Mae

abstract: The action is part of a growing attempt to force banks to pay billions of dollars for helping stoke the housing bubble.
snippet: The action is part of a growing attempt to force banks to pay billions of dollars for helping stoke the housing bubble.
lead_paragraph: A bruising legal fight pitting the country’s most powerful banks against the full force of the United States government began Friday, as federal regulators filed suits against 17 financial institutions that sold the mortgage giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac nearly $200 billion in mortgage-backed securities that later soured.

headline.main: Federal Regulators Sue Big Banks Over Mortgages

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)

byline.original: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Kevin Roose

abstract: Federal regulators filed suits on Friday against several of the nation’s leading banks, seeking billions in compensation for huge losses by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac on mortgage-backed securities the banks assembled during the housing boom.
snippet: Federal regulators filed suits on Friday against several of the nation’s leading banks, seeking billions in compensation for huge losses by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac on mortgage-backed securities the banks assembled during the housing boom.
lead_paragraph: Federal regulators filed suits on Friday against several of the nation’s leading banks, seeking billions in compensation for huge losses by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac on mortgage-backed securities the banks assembled during the housing boom, The New York Times reports. Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan Chase, Deutsche Bank, Citigroup, Barclays and Nomura are among the defendants in the suits, brought by the Federal Housing Finance Agency, which oversees Fannie and Freddie. Read more »

headline.main: Bank Suits Over Mortgages Are Filed
